content: Yes, there were several incidents of violence and conflict in the region prior to the Arab conquest of Jerusalem in 638 CE. The area that is now Israel and Palestine has a long and complex history of conflict and violence between different peoples and cultures, dating back thousands of years. Some of the most significant incidents include the Roman conquest and destruction of the Second Temple in 70 CE, the Bar Kokhba revolt in 132-135 CE, and the Persian invasion of the region in the early 7th century CE, among others.
